arts.ttl: Cheltenham Town v Bradford City RECAP: Luke Young screamer secures point
arts.sum: Luke Young's long-range strike earned Cheltenham Town a 1-1 home draw with Bradford City in League Two on Tuesday night. Bradford had opened the scoring through Neill Byrne's header from Richie Smallwood's free-kick in the fifth minute.

arts.ttl: Luke Young saves Cheltenham with a screamer against Bradford
arts.sum: The Bantams had taken an early lead through Neill Byrne.

arts.ttl: Cheltenham Town boss Michael Flynn on Bradford City spell, Andy Cook's threat and looking for consistency
arts.sum: Michael Flynn reflects fondly on his three-year spell as a Bradford City player and would love to see the former Premier League club rediscover their glory days. "Graham has put his mark on the team a bit more this season and they've had a good start," Flynn said.

arts.ttl: Best win so far, praise for Sam Stubbs and Jordan Thomas' talent - Cheltenham Town boss Michael Flynn after win at Colchester United
arts.sum: We can't get carried away and we have a really tough game now Tuesday night against Bradford City, who will be there or thereabouts at the end of the season, so we have to replicate that work ethic and mentality and hopefully at home we can have a little more quality and score some goals. We knew they had quality, knowing the players they've got, the Cowleys are experienced and they have a good budget as well.
